issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

versions.description: Maintenance release with new AMQP support and smaller modules

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
Similar to AMQ-4339

If the index is corrupted, ActiveMQ may receive an EOFException when the first message is published. The easiest way to replicate this for us has been to purposely put junk into a journal as so:

truncate -s 32700 db.data

The exception in this case has been (this error is specific to AMQ 5.6.0, so lines may mismatch on 5.8.0, but similar problem was confirmed on 5.8.0):

{code}

{code}

At the moment the only work-around I have is to blank out the db.data and let it get recreated from the journal.

I just want to stress that the corruption wasn't caused by KahaDB, at least we haven't seen any cases. The corruptions were either caused by: disk filling up, or bad copies when migrating directories etc.
fields.summary: Corrupt KahaDB Index may cause EOFException on first message
fields.environment: Java 1.6.0 most releases, tested on lots of different hardware, tested on Linux distros only.

comments.body: Recommend you try and create a unit test similar to the one in the referenced issue to reproduce the problem.
